intro: Cnicus falconeri, commonly known as the Falconer's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are generally spiny and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, rounded head. Cnicus falconeri is often found in open, sunny locations and is adapted to the unique climate of the Canary Islands.
